intro: Deilosma sibirica, commonly known as Siberian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the cold climates of eastern Siberia. It features slender, upright stems that bear lance-shaped leaves with a rough, hairy texture. The plant produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine environments. Deilosma sibirica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
